The Museum of Science and Industry (MSI) is located in Chicago, Illinois, in Jackson Park, in the Hyde Park neighborhood between Lake Michigan and The University of Chicago. It is housed in the former Palace of Fine Arts from the 1893 World's Columbian Exposition. Initially endowed during the 1906s, the MSI was opened in 1933 during the Century of Progress Exposition. It is the largest science museum in the Western Hemisphere.
